xdsl_modem_bdhcp_description: The MAC address is used to uniquely identify devices in the network (LAN and Internet). DHCP leases are used to assign a fixed IP address to a device through this MAC address. These leases are mainly used if you host services (web server, SSH, etc.) and you want to contact them from an external source via port forwarding rules (which you can configure in parallel).
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_ip_tooltip: The IP address must be within the range of 192.168.1.64 to 192.168.1.253
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_delete_really: Are you sure you want to delete the lease {{ name }}?
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_edit_success: The lease {{ name }} has been updated.
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_del_success: The lease {{ name }} has been deleted.
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_add_error: Oops! Unable to add lease {{ name }}.
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_edit_error: Oops! Unable to update lease {{ name }}.
xdsl_modem_bdhcp_del_error: Oops! Unable to delete lease {{ name }}.
